name: bohgan
normalized: you have finally come forth, beatrice kushan.
at last, it caught my eye.
the kushan fleet rose up from underneath the sandy waves and soared up over the heaving sand sea, under the dazzling sky.
i was convinced of a complete victory.
however, the communication situation was terrible due to the high concentration of the tachyon particles, and setting up contact with brigadier-general mecklinger had been ineffective.
the visual information of the enemy’s entire armoured cavalry unit rising up had already come forth.
the circumstances under which the kushan fleet had engaged with its enemy meant that the use of my strategy had been successful.

name: bohgan
normalized: ugh… mecklinger.
that man is going to chase my ass for a date now, isn’t he?

name: muller
normalized: hah.
the augusta battalion has surely drawn the attention of the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit, my lord.
lieutenant muller heard my mutterings and replied.
nonetheless, we had been given a quick shot at the kushan fleet in front of us, which would allow us to sink the enemy’s armoured mother-ship,
the enemy’s armoured cavalry unit, which was bound to be engaged in war with the augusta battalion by now, would only end up starving and becoming scraps of iron in the sand sea.
i got up from the seat, and declared beatrice kushan’s inevitable defeat.

name: bohgan
normalized: the empress may have won a hundred battles, but has only lived on to get ruined in her final one.
if one only looks back on history, it is fraught with such examples.

name: bohgan
normalized: do you understand?
your hundred victories have all been simply for my benefit, and i will dedicate them all to my victory.
mars will be ours.
and then, i loudly proclaimed towards my entire army.

name: bohgan
normalized: heroes of die erde!
destroy these pig-sluts!
and so――
the die erde fleet, with its overwhelming superiority with regards to its fleet numbers, and the ever-victorious kushan fleet,
calmly engaged each other in battle, while holding contrasting expectations of each other.
it was the beginning of the end for the soon-to-be renowned arcadia naval war.

name: muller
normalized: my lord, how should we engage?
muller asked me.
the die erde fleet was consisting of squadrons 1 through 4,
while the kushan fleet was consisting of squadrons 1 through 3.
just as i had anticipated, the kushan fleet had advanced south-west from the north-eastern direction,
while the die erde fleet had assumed an offensive formation and was advancing from the south-western direction towards the north-east, approaching it head-on.
like the ancient knights who clashed with lances, both fleets rushed towards their respective enemies head-on.

name: bohgan
normalized: stick to the portside of the kushan fleet!
use our broadside firepower to annihilate the enemy!
i decided to take the route which would allow us to take full advantage of the strength of our dominant force.
i was going to employ an extremely straightforward tactic in this naval battle, in order to not give the empress even an inkling of an opportunity to use her trickery.
in other words, to strike the enemy ship down the front and commence firing on the enemy’s portside or starboard side with our broadside firepower, when we ran parallel to them.

obviously, the long range and firepower of the battleships would be in effect, and the relative superiority or inferiority of this firepower would get translated to an equivalent superiority or inferiority in the battle.
three battleships of the kushan fleet to five battleships of the die erde fleet.
it was no exaggeration to suggest that the die erde fleet had twice the military power, and the firepower of our battleships was also dominant.
and while the kushan fleet had been an invincible fleet so far, it had been through long and taxing battles with the fleets of the neo-terras and the new-solars.
of course, this was the strategy that i, donny bohgan, put forth.
it was a tactically winnable situation.

name: bohgan
normalized: the insolent empress.
this is the time when i sink my teeth into her and devour her whole.

name: muller
normalized: yes, my lord.

name: bohgan
normalized: even though they didn’t have any choices left, separating their armoured cavalry unit from their main fleet means that their failure is now complete.

name: bohgan
normalized: in case i do manage to capture you alive, i will show you just how much of an inferior strategist you are to me.
i will thoroughly rape each and every hole of yours.

name: muller
normalized: my lord, i will be the first to rape her anally!

name: bohgan
normalized: kuku… i know.
i was smiling triumphantly,
however, i couldn’t believe my eyes when i saw what happened the very next instant.

name: bohgan
normalized: what!?
an astonishing development transpired.

name: operator
normalized: t-the enemy kushan’s fleet… i-is it a counter!?
it is a counter!
i can see the enemy fleet’s starboard side!
why are they exposing it!?
the operator’s report confirmed what i was witnessing.
the moment we got into reach of each other’s guns, the enemy’s ships began to turn its fore,
and all of a sudden, the kushan fleet turned its advance towards the western direction.

name: subordinates
normalized: that is so foolish!

name: subordinates
normalized: the fact that the ship is turning around its centre of gravity means it is equivalent to being stuck in a fixed position!

name: subordinates
normalized: the empress’s fount of wisdom seems to have dried up!
my subordinates raised voices of mockery, one after another.
indeed, it was necessary for the ship to be in constant motion.
unlike a ground battle, the naval battle was a bombardment against an ever-moving target,
and for that, there were some extraordinary exceptions to consider as well.
one of them was turning a ship like that.
for now, the ship was stationary in a considerably fixed position since it had to do a pivoting motion about its centre of gravity, until the direction of the fore could be changed.
in other words, it had become a stationary target.
needless to say, it could be hit if shot at.
in naval warfare, it was considered anathema to turn the ship’s fore like that, especially when engaged in a bombardment battle with the enemy.
it meant that it was no longer a stretch to think that the advantage had considerably shifted over to the side of the die erde fleet.

name: muller
normalized: my lord!
could this possibly mean…!?
conversely, as a sharp voice in me urged caution, muller was able to fathom what was happening as well.
he had been my lieutenant since cordelia after all.
he wasn’t just someone who enjoyed anal-sex.
i nodded to muller to convey that i had understood him and roared scornfully at my men, who were overtly mocking the enemy.

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t be mistaken!
this is the t-character strategy.

name: subordinates
normalized: t-character strategy!?

name: bohgan
normalized: many things have been forgotten in this modern age, where space fleet warfare is now mainstream, however, this is one of the tactics that was practical in the wars of the early twentieth century.

name: subordinates
normalized: i-it is a tactic, huh!?

name: bohgan
normalized: that is correct.
they will intercept with a singular vertical team along their side, which is why it is known as the t-character strategy.

name: bohgan
normalized: the singular vertical team of their ships won’t be effective by itself, however, their broadsides will enable all ships to fire against their enemy.

name: subordinates
normalized: d-does that mean, the forward unit of our fleet is going straight into the enemy’s broadside semi-siege…!?

name: bohgan
normalized: that’s right!
this may be the secret hand of the empress.
her trump card in order to triumph over our fleet, which is numerically superior.

name: bohgan
normalized: beatrice kushan is exactly as i suspected her to be.
she is even making light of a perilous place like the sand sea.

name: bohgan
normalized: it was no coincidence that the foolish neo-terras and new-solars were scattered to the winds!
kuhahahahahaha!

name: subordinates
normalized: m-my lord, if our enemy’s objective is to employ the t-character strategy, then we are in a serious predicament!
the men, who had been mocking the empress just a while back, became agitated.
oh dear――
my die erde fleet had achieved a monumental victory in the war of the tertiary atmosphere of cordelia.
however, it looked like they had gotten used to winning easily.
i breathed out a heartfelt sigh and raised my hand to stop my men.

name: bohgan
normalized: there is no need to panic!

name: bohgan
normalized: the biggest failing of this strategy of the empress is that i have seen through it completely, which will ultimately lead me to be placed in the archives of the history of this war!

name: bohgan
normalized: gentlemen, if we can grasp the enemy’s tactics, it is easy to deal with them!
at last, the battle had reached its final stage, where the empress’s tactics would be completely obliterated.
i was completely convinced of my victory.

name: bohgan
normalized: hard to starboard!
turn to starboard and blow up the backsides of the enemy fleet!
be sure to put down our crossfire points at the very last moment!

name: my men
normalized: yes sir!
the die erde fleet deployed its countermeasures and started turning to starboard.
the flagship, rothlingen, tilted greatly due to the turning heavily at maximum speed.
the sandy surface tore sharply as the ship leaned over it, raising a creaking sound in the process, and it would have started vibrating had it been in outer space.
the starboard head came into the range of the kushan fleet at the very last momemt, as it attempted to execute the t-character strategy.
the fore of the ship turned to the right while licking the sandy surface, in order to enable us to concentrate our firepower on the backsides of the enemy.

name: my men
normalized: ooh!
it looked like my subordinates had finally realized my intentions.
the ship continued to move ceaselessly.
it couldn’t be stopped now, since it wasn’t easy to change its direction.
the kushan fleet was caught in its biggest trap.
on one hand, it could attempt to avoid the crossfire points from the entirety of our fleet,
while on the other hand, in case their fleet reversed backwards, then their defeat was inevitable.
the armour in the back of any ship was extremely thin, and the firepower on that side was light too.
in which case, the kushan fleet would be destined to be swallowed up in our bombardment and destroyed while being forced to bleed from their butts.

name: my men
normalized: my lord!
that was beautiful!
my men raised voices of admiration on seeing my tactical vision in work, which had broken the t-character strategy of the enemy.

name: bohgan
normalized: it appears that we have won.
however, right then,
i heard the operator raise his voice.

name: operator
normalized: i am picking up something in the sand up ahead!

name: bohgan
normalized: what!?
a chill ran up my spine.

name: operator
normalized: is it an undersea mine!?
there are countless undersea mine sources ahead!

name: bohgan
normalized: tchh!
that terrifying report was enough to destroy my conviction in our victory.
numerous mines dominated the direction of travel of the die erde fleet, in the sandy areas through which the kushan fleet had drifted through just now.
their destroyers in the rear-guard had probably scattered them while passing through.

name: muller
normalized: we have been blocked from progressing in the sea!
all i could do was groan out at the mess that we had been trapped in.

name: bohgan
normalized: did we consider…!?
and then it struck me… that i would have insight about t-character strategy, that i would try to strategize and counter around that situation――
the empress had read me from the very beginning.
furthermore, she had even made preparations in order to block off our vanguard.
if not the case, it was extremely unlikely that she would have prepared and deployed as many mines as she had done just now.

name: muller
normalized: enemy confirmed on portside, alter our course!

name: bohgan
normalized: kuuh!
right at that moment, she appeared!
and just like that, the die erde fleet had been driven to its doom.
the direction of travel was blocked, and the only way to move was to go starboard or portside.
there was no other choice.
if we turned left, we would end up lunging right into the semi-siege of the enemy fleet.
if we turned right, we would have our butts blown off, and eventually bleed to death.
and so,
we had no choice but to move,
right into the danger zone.
the danger zone, which still held a miniscule possibility of victory.

name: bohgan
normalized: hard to portside!

name: subordinates
normalized: my lord!?

name: subordinates
normalized: if we do that, won’t we end up lunging right into the semi-siege of the enemy!?
i was aware of it.
however, that was the only way.
we had to penetrate the enemy fleet’s core with our ship at maximum speed.
obviously, that passage was right through the crossfire point of the enemy, so we had to be prepared for a massive strike.
however, there was still a chance.
the possibilities weren’t nil yet.
if we could manage to successfully break through the core of the enemy’s fleet, we would be able to split up and, conversely, lay a siege of our own.
if we showed our backsides to the enemy’s fleet, we would definitely seal our fate of dying by bleeding out completely.

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t make me say it again!
steer to portside!

name: subordinates
normalized: y-yes sir!
turning hard to portside!
the whole ship, which had been creaking a while ago, took the path to the left in search of one last hurrah before its eventual demise.

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t think that you have won this yet, empress.
i will be sure to stab a blow to your throat, like a viper!
i glared towards the kushan fleet―― at beatrice, who was there.

name: operator
normalized: the enemy fleet is turning portside!
the portside!
the die erde fleet was about to jump into the danger zone.
a stir spread out across the kushan fleet headquarters.

name: beatrice
normalized: fufufu… that’s all there is to it.
the empress, beatrice kushan, was on the mother-ship, triumph, smiling fearlessly.

name: operator
normalized: the enemy has increased the speed of their advance!
the enemy fleet had turned around, and was coming to the middle of the crossfire point at their maximum speed.

name: beatrice
normalized: hmm.
that man named donny bohgan… at least, he doesn’t seem to be incompetent.
he is even prepared to bleed in order to take a bite at our bones.

name: deputy
normalized: commodore, would you like to begin?

name: beatrice
normalized: it is on schedule.

name: deputy
normalized: as you will.

name: beatrice
normalized: i am not the gentle kind, donny bohgan.
beatrice fluttered her pure white mantle,

name: beatrice
normalized: trample them!
she screamed, which sounded like the roar of a leopardess.
numerous flashing blades of light shot out from the kushan fleet, as it attacked the die erde fleet.
flashes of death spread over the sand sea, one after another.
beatrice kushan had read donny bohgan’s intentions.
as of now, not many could determine what was transpiring amidst the chaos.
still, the commanders on both sides were able to sense the changes on the battlefield.
the defeated die erde fleet had turned left to the north-western direction and was attempting to break through the kushan fleet’s core, by advancing their fleet at their maximum speed.
on the other hand, the kushan fleet had, similarly, turned to the left and was drawing a semicircle with the help of its troops,
it was possible for them to take the ideal semi-enveloping position, while concentrating their firepower on the frontal side of the advancing die erde fleet.
the die erde fleet knew that it had only the one option, which was to rush through the danger zone, through the fierce crossfire of their enemy’s guns.
and so, the crossfire of the kushan fleet began destroying die erde’s defenceless ships, one after another.

two battleships, a battle-cruiser and a thin armoured destroyer that were first in the line of sight of their three battleships were fired upon, and within half a minute all of those had gotten extremely damaged, while one had sunk instantly.

name: beatrice
normalized: well then, let us finish it.
in an attempt to inflict heavy haemorrhaging on the die erde fleet, beatrice deliberately created a passage among the row of her ships, in the direction of the enemy’s advance.
she was going to raise even more hell in the danger zone when the enemy got there, having lunged in head-first.
it was entirely like watching a wounded bull being provoked by the red mantle of a bull-fighter.

name: bohgan
normalized: kuuh… the empress!
bohgan had realized it too.
even though he knew it, he had no choice but to invite himself into that hell.
―― thirty minutes later.
the die erde fleet was completely besieged and awaited its demise.
beatrice had pretended to split up her fleet due to the desperate lunge which had been made by the die erde fleet to break through their core,
however, in reality the squadrons 2 and 3 had suddenly started to turn to starboard in conjunction with the advance of the die erde fleet.
and consequently, just as the die erde fleet had invited itself in, both those squadrons were running parallel to each other.
they had been sandwiched by her fleet on both sides.
by the time the die erde fleet could notice this development,
a fierce wound was inflicted by the main squadron of the kushan fleet, squadron 1, which had crowded the backside of the enemy’s advancing fleet.
there was to be no escape.
it was pure hell.

name: bohgan
normalized: don’t yield!
position our thick armoured ships on the outside and concentrate your firepower!
we must break through!
bohgan was desperately trying to keep the fleet up, which was on the verge of collapse.
he tried to keep the haemorrhaging of his fleet to a minimum while trying to find a path through this enforced hell.
all the while, commanding the concentration of firepower on the weak parts of the enemy, all for the sake of getting a break through the siege.
he had tasted the bitterness of numerous enemies, however, the tenacity of this survivor of a man was still intact.

name: beatrice
normalized: how stubborn…
beatrice muttered in a low voice in the face of having met an enemy, who continued to resist her in an orderly manner.

name: beatrice
normalized: donny bohgan… i have heard that that man is like a viper, however… i see.
she couldn’t help but admire and, simultaneously, get annoyed by her enemy.

name: beatrice
normalized: however, that is as far as you go.
are you here yet, kila?

name: kila
normalized: yes, mother♪

name: beatrice
normalized: keep donny bohgan alive.
other than him…

name: kila
normalized: i will bury them all♪
the empress and her daughter had a similar face.
they both flashed their beautiful yet cruel smiles.
and then――
lieutenant kila kushan arrived on the battlefield, having defeated the augusta battalion with her armoured cavalry unit.
in order to stab the viper and deliver the finishing blow.
in the end, his victory was never achieved.
